intro: Brachyris dracunculoides, commonly known as the dragon's tail, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its common name reflects the appearance of its clustered, tail-like inflorescence.
